channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Brazil's Pinheiro Braathen wins gold, and South America's first Winter Olympics medal
item.description: Once a racer for Norway, Pinheiro Braathen switched to Brazil, his mother's home country. In winning the Olympic giant slalom on Saturday, he earned South America's first medal at a Winter Games.
item.content:encoded:
Once a racer for Norway, Pinheiro Braathen switched to Brazil, his mother's home country. In winning the Olympic giant slalom on Saturday, he earned South America's first medal at a Winter Games.

(Image credit: Rebecca Blackwell)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Want a mortgage for under 3% in 2026? Meet the 'assumable mortgage'
item.description: Low mortgage rates from the COVID era might still be attainable for homebuyers, if they find the right house and have the cash.
item.content:encoded:
Low mortgage rates from the COVID era might still be attainable for homebuyers, if they find the right house and have the cash.

(Image credit: Rich Pedroncelli)
item.dc:creator: Stephan Bisaha

item.title: For U.S. pairs skater Danny O'Shea, these Olympics are 30 years in the making
item.description: Danny O'Shea turned 35 at his first Olympics, after three decades of skating and two reversed retirements.
item.content:encoded:
Danny O'Shea turned 35 at his first Olympics, after three decades of skating and two reversed retirements.

(Image credit: Elsa)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Epstein files fallout takes down elite figures in Europe, while U.S. reckoning is muted
item.description: Unlike in Europe, officials in the U.S. with ties to Epstein have largely held their positions of power.
item.content:encoded:
Unlike in Europe, officials in the U.S. with ties to Epstein have largely held their positions of power.

(Image credit: Kirsty Wigglesworth)
item.dc:creator: Joseph Shapiro

item.title: A London beat framed by colonial history
item.description: NPR's Lauren Frayer arrived in London after years in India, and she's been covering Britain with the legacy of empire in view.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Lauren Frayer arrived in London after years in India, and she's been covering Britain with the legacy of empire in view.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: Four people on NASA'S Crew-12 arrive at the International Space Station
item.description: The crew will spend the next eight months conducting experiments to prepare for human exploration beyond Earth's orbit.
item.content:encoded:
The crew will spend the next eight months conducting experiments to prepare for human exploration beyond Earth's orbit.

(Image credit: NASA)
item.dc:creator: Lydia Calitri

item.title: American speedskater Jordan Stolz wins second Olympic gold with 500-meter race victory
item.description: With the win, Stolz joins Eric Heiden as the only skaters to take gold in both the 500 and 1,000 at the same Olympics.
item.content:encoded:
With the win, Stolz joins Eric Heiden as the only skaters to take gold in both the 500 and 1,000 at the same Olympics.

(Image credit: Ben Curtis)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: US military reports a series of airstrikes against Islamic State targets in Syria
item.description: The U.S. military says the strikes were carried out in retaliation of the December ambush that killed two U.S. soldiers and one American civilian interpreter.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. military says the strikes were carried out in retaliation of the December ambush that killed two U.S. soldiers and one American civilian interpreter.

(Image credit: Lolita Baldor)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 5 European nations say Alexei Navalny was poisoned and blame the Kremlin
item.description: In a joint statement, the foreign ministries of the U.K., France, Germany, Sweden and the Netherlands say Navalny was poisoned by Russia with a lethal toxin derived from the skin of poison dart frogs.
item.content:encoded:
In a joint statement, the foreign ministries of the U.K., France, Germany, Sweden and the Netherlands say Navalny was poisoned by Russia with a lethal toxin derived from the skin of poison dart frogs.

(Image credit: Alexander Zemlianichenko)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Opinion: Disqualified but not forgotten
item.description: A Ukrainian athlete was disqualified from competition this week by the International Olympic Committee because his helmet had images of other Ukrainian athletes killed in Russia's war on his country.
item.content:encoded:
A Ukrainian athlete was disqualified from competition this week by the International Olympic Committee because his helmet had images of other Ukrainian athletes killed in Russia's war on his country.

(Image credit: Al Bello/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon
